explains: adj. 操纵的，善于摆布（他人）的；熟练操作的，有操作能力的；推拿的

sentences.en: He described Mr. Long as cold, calculating, and manipulative.
sentences.cn: 他把朗先生描述为冷漠、有心计和善于操纵别人。

sentences.en: "People assume that office politics involves some manipulative behavior," says Deborah Comer, an assistant professor of management at Hofstra University.
sentences.cn: 霍夫斯特拉大学的管理学助理教授黛博拉·科默说：“人们认为办公室政治涉及一些操纵行为。”

sentences.en: She is devious and sly and manipulative.
sentences.cn: 她阴险、狡诈，而且爱操纵他人。
